intro: Paesia tahitensis, commonly known as the Tahitian paesia, is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate with high humidity and salt exposure. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellow, often appearing in clusters. Paesia tahitensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited geographic distribution.
